results.title: Behaviour patterns and survival
results.brief_description: Depicts the behaviour of the Slaty Backed Gull. Types of chick behaviour, innate and learned are shown by response to parent’s voice. Originally in Japanese - dubbed into English. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Erosion of our land
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: An examination of four areas of New Zealand that are troubled by problems of erosion and the attempts made by farmers and others to ensure better use of the land.

results.title: The Cat's meow
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Oxford Scientific Films
results.brief_description: A live action cat-and-mouse story about several playful mice, an inquisitive house cat, and his cousin, the alley cat, which is shown as a serious struggle for survival and a comic standoff between lively opponents. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.brief_description: Shows Dr David Elkind as he works with children aged four to eleven years and elicits their concepts of the physical, moral and religious world.

results.title: The Hunters
results.creator_credit: John Marshall and Film Study Center of the Peabody museum of Harvard University
results.brief_description: A study of the life and culture of four indigenous African bushmen as they hunt a giraffe and other game in the Kalahari Desert. Shows the difficulties of survival in a desert region and the skills displayed by the bushmen. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Basketry
results.brief_description: This film examines basketmaking techniques from around the world, demonstrates the two principal techniques used in basketmaking and shows how both modern and traditional materials can be used. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Ancient Tashkent: an impression
results.brief_description: For a relatively short time Tashkent was a great market city on the spice route from China to Europe. This lyrical non-narrative film draws in viewers to experience for themselves the richness of its mosaics and the grandeur of its architecture. Makes imaginitive use of authentic Uzbek music.
